cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 124 (Wednesday, July 19, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FLOOD:H.R. 4737.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18:To make all Laws which shall be necessary and proper forcarrying into Execution the foregoing Powers, and all otherPowers vested by this Constitution in the Government of theUnited States,The single subject of this legislation is:This bill would ensure that banking regulators providepublic notice on any non-binding recommendations from FSOCthey implement.[Page H3858]

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 264.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

cdata.text:
Stop Executive Capture of Banking Regulators Act

This bill requires banking and financial regulatory entities to report to Congress prior to implementing a non-binding recommendation from the Financial Stability Oversight Council or contained in an Executive Order. This requirement applies to the Board Of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the National Credit Union Administration, and the Federal Housing Finance Administration.

bill.title: Stop Executive Capture of Banking Regulators Act

item.title: Stop Executive Capture of Banking Regulators Act
Stop Executive Capture of Banking Regulators Act
To require Federal banking regulators to report on the implementation of recommendations from the FSOC Chairperson and Executive Orders, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
